## **Aim**

Protect and safeguard genetic diversity (within and between species populations) of wild, managed, and cultivated species for human well-being and ecosystem resilience.

## **Metrics/ EBVs/EESVs**

### Proposed EBVs

[Hoban et al (2022)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/brv.12852) have proposed the following Genetic Composition Essential Biodiversity Variables (EBVs),

-   **Genetic Diversity** (Richness and evenness)

-   **Genetic Differentiation** (Number of genetic units and differentiation between units)

-   **Inbreeding**

-   **Effective Population Size** (Ne)

### EBVs characteristics

[Hoban et al (2022)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/brv.12852) summarized the four proposed Genetic Composition Essential Biodiversity Variables (EBVs) in Table 1, including their definitions, possible values, interpretation, and a ranking from low (+) to high (+++) on various EBV criteria (rows).

## **Indicators**

Several indicators have been proposed

-   Proportion of species populations with effective population sizes (Ne) \> 500. "The"Ne indicator" is currently included in the GBF monitoring framework as a headline indicator (A.5, CBD [2022e](https://www.cbd.int/doc/c/c9de/d8ef/7225d7bb822f39ad3426c52b/cop-15-02-en.pdf "CBD 2022e. Draft decisions for the fifteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity. CBD/COP/15/2. Page 18. UNEP. URL https://www.cbd.int/doc/c/c9de/d8ef/7225d7bb822f39ad3426c52b/cop-15-02-en.pdf"), previously A.0.4 CBD [2021c](https://www.cbd.int/doc/c/3303/d892/4fd11c27963bd3f826a961e1/wg2020-04-04-en.pdf "CBD 2021c. Proposed headline indicators of the monitoring framework for the post-2020 global biodiversity framework. CBD/WG2020/3/3/Add.1. UNEP. URL https://www.cbd.int/doc/c/d716/da69/5e81c8e0faca1db1dd145a59/wg2020-03-03-add1-en.pdf")) for Goal A." ([Hoban et al 2023](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10592-022-01492-0)), see also in [metadata for indicators](https://www.post-2020indicators.org/) A4.

[Hoban et al (2023)](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10592-022-01492-0){style="font-size: 11pt;"} also discussed additional indicators, for instance:

-   "Maintain genetic diversity within populations"

-   "No loss of distinct populations"

-   "The safeguarding" component indicator

-   "The genetic scored" indicator
